About Me

I am a penultimate year Chemical Engineering student at Imperial College London with a keen interest in finance and technology backed by a technical and analytical foundation in engineering. With the advent of AI, Big Data, rampant cyber-attacks and widespread disruption across all industries, it is more important than ever for businesses to transform themselves through innovation and implementation of new platforms, architecture and tech and I want to help them achieve that. Some of my previous work experience includes:

Deloitte India | June-July 2018

Corporate Finance Intern

Undertook secondary research and analysed data from various sources for potential M&A opportunities in the industrial products, chemical and edible oil sectors in India. Critically evaluated market trends, growth charts, annual reports and financial statements of client's competitors.

Imperial Consulting Group | Nov-Dec 2017

Associate

Carried out market research to determine whether the continuous glucose monitor developed by a healthcare startup is worth commercialising and attended client meetings to present our findings and discuss the long-term strategy which honed my presentation skills.

Fine Organics | May-June 2017

Research Assistant

Worked in the food and polymer labs developing new methods to produce additives and emulsifiers to improve product quality and carried out trials using high tech analytical techniques to test the quality, effectiveness and feasibility of the additives/emulsifiers.
